quote.text: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.
quote.author: 1 Corinthians

quote.text: If I speak in human and angelic tongues but do not have love, I am a resounding gong or a clashing cymbal.
quote.author: 1 Corinthians

quote.text: And if I have the gift of prophesy and comprehend all mysteries and all knowledge; if I have all faith so as to move mountains but do not have love, I am nothing.
quote.author: 1 Corinthians

quote.text: If I give away everything I own, and if I hand my body over so that I may boast but do not have love, I gain nothing.
quote.author: 1 Corinthians

quote.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It is not jealous, [love] is not pompous, it is not inflated, it is not rude, it does not seek its own interests, it is not quick-tempered, it does not brood over injury, it does not rejoice over wrongdoing but rejoices with the truth. It bears all things, believes in all things, hopes all things, endures all things.
quote.author: 1 Corinthians

quote.text: Love never fails. If there are prophecies, they will be brought to nothing; if tounges, they will cease; if knowledge, it will be brought to nothing.
quote.author: Corinthians

quote.text: For we know partially and we prophesy partially, but when the perfect comes, the partial will pass away.
quote.author: Corinthians

quote.text: When I was a child, I used to talk as a child, think as a child, reason as a child; when I became a man, I put aside childish things.
quote.author: Corinthians

quote.text: At present, we see indistinctly, as in a mirror, but then face to face. At present I know partially; then I shall know fully, as I am fully known.
quote.author: Corinthians

quote.text: So faith, hope, love remain, these three; but the greatest of these is love.
quote.author: Corinthians

quote.text: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures; And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve: After that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep. After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles. And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.
quote.author: 1 Corinthians

quote.text: O death, where is thy sting? O grave, where is thy victory?
quote.author: 1 Corinthians
